intro: Hymenolepis spicata, commonly known as the spiny bladder grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the Poaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Hymenolepis spicata is typically found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its botanical features make it an important component of local ecosystems and a subject of study in plant taxonomy.
